item.title: The Power Law Illusion: A Measurement Artifact Hypothesis
item.description: Many phenomena we interpret as following power law distributions may actually be one tail of underlying bell-shaped (Gaussian, Poisson, or other unimodal) distributions. We observe apparent power laws because we systematically measure only one side of these distributions.
